info.title: The Rick and Morty API
info.description:
This is an example API proxied via Zuplo - these docs are generated based on the gateway configuration. Full credit to the original and upstream API, which is available at rickandmortyapi.com. 

 The source for the gateway is available on GitHub [here](https://github.com/zuplo-samples/rick-and-morty). 

 **To use this API: 1) visit the pricing page from the top menu , 2) subscribe to any plan using a [fake credit card](https://docs.stripe.com/testing#cards) like `4242 4242 4242 4242` and any expire date and CVC and 3) copy your API key and start using the API.**

get.description: You can access the list of characters by using the `/characters` endpoint. Pagination is supported via the `?page=2` querystring. You can also filter the results using the `name`, `status`, `species`, `type` and `gender` query parameters.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The `Authorization` header is used to authenticate with the API using your API key. Value is of the format `Bearer YOUR_KEY_HERE`.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Pagination index

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: filter by the given name

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: filter by the status, one of `dead`, `alive` or `unknown`

parameters.name: species
parameters.description: filter by the species

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: filter by the given type

parameters.name: gender
parameters.description: filter by the given gender (female, male, genderless or unknown)

get.description: You can get a single character by ID, or multiple by adding an array of ids as parameter: `/characters/[1,2,3]` or `/characters/1,2,3`

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The `Authorization` header is used to authenticate with the API using your API key. Value is of the format `Bearer YOUR_KEY_HERE`.

parameters.name: characterId
parameters.description: A single numeric ID or multiple IDs, e.g. `[1,2,3]` or `1,2`

get.description: Returns the OpenAPI file of this API.
